label: Multi-Modal Trip Search & Comparison
description: AI-powered search across flights, hotels, and car rentals with intelligent bundling and real-time price comparison delivering 15-25% cost savings through optimal combinations.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer searches flight on airline website, then separately searches hotels on booking site, then car rentals on third site. 2. Customer manually compares prices across 5-10 tabs in browser. 3. Customer calculates total trip cost in spreadsheet or notepad. 4. Customer books each component separately with different confirmations. 5. No bundling discounts or package optimization realized.
constraints: Customer must search 3+ separate websites for complete trip
Manual comparison across 10-20 browser tabs is time-consuming
Missed bundling opportunities cost 15-25% in savings
No optimization for connection times or location proximity
Price changes between searches lead to abandoned bookings
90-120 minutes average time to research and book complete trip

agentic.workflow: 1. Trip Search Agent receives customer input: destination, dates, preferences (direct flights, hotel rating, car size). 2. Multi-Modal Agent simultaneously searches flights (via NDC/GDS), hotels (via APIs), and car rentals across 50+ providers. 3. Bundling Optimization Agent identifies best combinations with connection times, hotel-airport proximity, cost savings. 4. Agent presents top 3-5 optimized packages with clear comparison (total cost, travel time, ratings). 5. Customer selects package and books all components in single transaction.
dataSources: Flight inventory via NDC and GDS (Amadeus, Sabre)
benefits: 15-25% cost savings through intelligent bundling vs separate bookings
Optimized itineraries with minimal connection times
Real-time price guarantees prevent cart abandonment

quickWins: Implement flight+hotel bundling for top 10 routes
Add real-time price comparison across 3 providers
prerequisites: Hotel and car rental API integrations

label: Dynamic Packaging & Bundling
description: Real-time package assembly with personalized bundling rules delivering 20-30% ancillary revenue increase through intelligent cross-sell and upsell.

traditional.workflow: 1. Marketing team creates 3-5 static package deals (e.g., 'Vegas Getaway' with flight+hotel+show tickets). 2. Packages hard-coded with fixed dates, fixed hotels, fixed add-ons. 3. Customer must fit into pre-defined package or book separately. 4. No personalization based on customer preferences or past behavior. 5. Packages updated quarterly, can't respond to demand or inventory.
constraints: 3-5 static packages can't serve diverse customer needs
Fixed packages miss 80%+ of bundling opportunities
No dynamic pricing based on inventory or demand
Quarterly updates mean stale packages with poor inventory
No personalization (same package for honeymoon vs family)
15-20% ancillary attach rate due to generic bundles

agentic.workflow: 1. Dynamic Packaging Agent analyzes customer profile: travel purpose (business, leisure, family), past bookings, price sensitivity. 2. Agent assembles personalized package in real-time: base (flight+hotel) + recommended add-ons (tours, insurance, upgrades, transfers). 3. Bundling Rules Engine applies optimal discounts: 10% off hotel when bundled with flight, free breakfast for 3+ night stays. 4. Agent dynamically prices package based on inventory levels and demand forecasting. 5. Upsell Agent suggests relevant add-ons at checkout (lounge access, seat upgrade, early check-in).
dataSources: Bundling discount rules and margin targets
benefits: 20-30% ancillary revenue increase through intelligent bundling
Unlimited package variants vs 3-5 static packages
Dynamic pricing optimizes revenue and inventory
Real-time adaptation to inventory and demand

quickWins: Implement dynamic flight+hotel bundling with 10% discount
Add personalized ancillary recommendations at checkout

label: Real-Time Availability & Pricing
description: Live inventory and dynamic pricing with sub-second updates preventing 30-50% cart abandonment from stale pricing and sold-out inventory errors.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer searches flights and sees cached prices from 15-30 minutes ago. 2. Customer selects flight and proceeds to checkout. 3. At checkout, price has changed or seat sold out - error message displayed. 4. Customer must restart search, often encountering different prices again. 5. 30-50% cart abandonment rate due to pricing errors and stale inventory.
constraints: Cached pricing 15-30 minutes stale leads to booking errors
30-50% cart abandonment when price increases at checkout
Sold-out inventory not detected until checkout attempt
Batch inventory updates every 5-15 minutes miss rapid changes
Peak demand periods overwhelm systems with inventory conflicts
Customer frustration from repeated search-to-booking failures

agentic.workflow: 1. Real-Time Inventory Agent maintains live connection to supplier systems (NDC, GDS, hotel APIs) with sub-second updates. 2. Dynamic Pricing Agent streams real-time fare changes and availability to customer search results. 3. Price Lock Agent guarantees price for 10-15 minutes once customer selects option (prevents mid-booking changes). 4. Availability Validation Agent confirms inventory immediately before payment processing. 5. Agent gracefully handles sold-out scenarios: instant alternative suggestions, waitlist options.
dataSources: Dynamic pricing algorithms and fare rules
benefits: Sub-second price updates vs 15-30 min stale data
Price lock feature provides customer confidence
Instant alternative suggestions prevent lost bookings
Peak period performance maintained with real-time architecture

quickWins: Implement 10-minute price lock for selected flights
Reduce inventory cache from 15 min to 2 min

label: Booking Workflow Automation
description: End-to-end booking automation with intelligent form filling and passenger data management reducing booking time from 15-20 minutes to 3-5 minutes.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer manually enters passenger details: name, DOB, passport, frequent flyer numbers, TSA PreCheck. 2. Customer re-enters same payment information every booking. 3. Customer must remember and enter corporate travel policy codes. 4. Customer fills out 15-25 form fields per passenger. 5. Form errors require re-submission (incorrect date format, missing required fields).
constraints: 15-20 minutes to complete booking due to manual data entry
Customer must re-enter passenger data for every booking
Payment information not securely saved (re-entry required)
10-15% form abandonment due to tedious data entry
Corporate travelers must manually enter policy codes
Typos in passenger names cause ticketing issues

agentic.workflow: 1. Passenger Profile Agent auto-loads traveler details from customer profile: names, DOB, passport info, Known Traveler Numbers. 2. Auto-Fill Agent populates all form fields instantly with validated data. 3. Payment Vault Agent securely retrieves saved payment methods (PCI-compliant). 4. Corporate Policy Agent auto-applies travel policy rules for business bookings (approved vendors, fare classes). 5. Validation Agent checks passenger data against airline requirements, flags issues before submission.
dataSources: Frequent flyer and loyalty program numbers
TSA PreCheck and Global Entry numbers
benefits: 95%+ auto-fill rate eliminates manual data entry
Corporate policy auto-compliance for business travel

quickWins: Implement passenger profile auto-fill for returning customers

label: Payment & Ticketing
description: Instant ticketing with multi-payment methods and automated ticket delivery reducing payment failures by 60-70% and enabling instant confirmation.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer enters credit card details manually at checkout. 2. Payment gateway processes charge, 8-12% fail due to fraud blocks, expired cards, insufficient funds. 3. Ticketing batch runs every 2-4 hours - customer waits for confirmation. 4. E-tickets emailed 30-90 minutes after payment. 5. Failed payments require customer to restart entire booking process.
constraints: 8-12% payment failure rate due to limited recovery options
Batch ticketing delays confirmation 30-90 minutes
Single payment method (credit card only in many cases)
Payment failures require full booking restart
No real-time fraud detection (manual review delays bookings)
Corporate split-payment scenarios not supported

agentic.workflow: 1. Payment Orchestration Agent offers 8-12 payment methods: credit cards, digital wallets, BNPL, rewards points, corporate cards. 2. Fraud Detection Agent performs real-time scoring, approves 95%+ legitimate transactions instantly. 3. Payment Retry Agent auto-retries failed payments with intelligent fallback (try secondary card, suggest alternative method). 4. Instant Ticketing Agent issues e-ticket within seconds of payment approval. 5. Multi-Channel Delivery Agent sends ticket via email, SMS, mobile app push, and wallet (Apple/Google).
dataSources: Customer payment history and risk profile
Digital wallet integrations (Apple Pay, Google Pay)
Loyalty points balance and redemption rules
benefits: Instant ticketing (<30 sec) vs 30-90 min batch
Multi-channel ticket delivery prevents lost confirmations

quickWins: Add Apple Pay and Google Pay
Implement real-time fraud scoring for instant approvals

label: Booking Modification & Cancellation
description: Self-service change management with intelligent rebooking and automated refund processing reducing agent call volume by 50-70% and modification time from hours to minutes.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer needs to change flight date or cancel booking. 2. Customer calls contact center, waits 15-45 minutes on hold. 3. Agent manually looks up booking, checks fare rules, calculates change fees. 4. Agent processes change or cancellation manually in airline system. 5. Refund requests take 7-14 days for processing and approval.
constraints: 15-45 min hold time for changes/cancellations
100% agent-assisted modifications (no self-service)
Change fees and fare rules unclear to customers
Refunds take 7-14 days (manual approval workflow)
Peak disruption periods overwhelm call centers
Agent costs $8-15 per call for simple modifications

agentic.workflow: 1. Customer accesses booking via mobile app or web using confirmation code. 2. Modification Agent displays available options: date change, passenger name correction, seat selection, cancellation. 3. Fare Rules Engine shows applicable fees, refund eligibility, alternative flights with price differences. 4. Agent processes modification instantly via NDC/GDS APIs with real-time seat availability. 5. Automated Refund Agent processes eligible refunds within 24-48 hours (auto-approval for policy-compliant requests).
dataSources: Airline fare rules and change policies
Waiver and exception policies (weather, airline-caused delays)
benefits: 24-48 hour refunds vs 7-14 day manual processing
Clear fare rules eliminate customer confusion

quickWins: Implement self-service date change for flexible fares
Automate refunds for cancellations >7 days before departure

label: Group Booking Management
description: Automated group reservation coordination with split payments and multi-passenger management reducing group booking complexity by 70-80% through intelligent orchestration.

traditional.workflow: 1. Group organizer calls group desk for 10+ passenger booking. 2. Agent manually checks availability and provides quote (24-48 hour turnaround). 3. Organizer collects passenger details via email/spreadsheet from group members. 4. Organizer calls back to finalize booking, reads 10+ passenger details over phone. 5. Organizer collects individual payments manually (Venmo, checks), then pays airline in lump sum.
constraints: 100% phone-based (no online group booking)
24-48 hour quote turnaround time
Manual passenger data collection via email/spreadsheet
Organizer liability for full payment upfront
No individual payment splitting capability
Name changes and modifications require agent calls (×10+ passengers)

agentic.workflow: 1. Group Booking Agent allows organizer to create group reservation online (10+ passengers). 2. Agent provides instant group pricing with hold period (7-14 days). 3. Organizer shares unique link with group members to enter their own passenger details. 4. Split Payment Agent enables individual payment: each traveler pays their own fare, or organizer sets split rules. 5. Agent auto-consolidates passenger data, processes payments, issues tickets when threshold met (e.g., 80% paid).
dataSources: Airline group booking policies (minimums, deposit requirements)
benefits: Individual payment splitting eliminates organizer liability
Real-time payment tracking dashboard for organizer
Automated reminders to non-responsive group members

quickWins: Launch online group booking for 10-25 passenger groups
Implement split payment for group organizers
